document.docAuthor: Soto, Eduardo M. & Ramírez, Martín J.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Liparotoma amoenum Simon, 1884: 138
(immature holotype from Cabo de Hornos, in MHNP, not reexamined).
Ramírez, 1993: 202
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: Resembles
P. hyadesi
and
P. doilu
by the elongate paramedian apophysis and transversely wrinkled median field of the epigyne ( Fig. 4b–e ). It can be easily distinguished by having a much higher cephalic area ( Fig. 1b ; Ramírez 1993 : fig. 23).
Description: Male and female described in Ramírez (1993 , 2003 ).
Distribution: Southern forests in Chile , from Cautín (Región IX) to Valdivia province (Región X), and Argentina , from Neuquén to Cabo de Hornos ( Fig. 38c , Ramírez 1993 , 2003 ).
